title: 25 Years of Rites of Passage: Ritual & Burning Man
description: This event is an open-forum discussion hosted by academics and intellectuals interested in the Burning Man project (members of the "Burning Nerds" group). This session centers on an analysis of ritual action/rites of passage and impact on evolving concepts of community at Burning Man over twenty-five years, 1986-2011. Session to be held in main dome at Camp Make Good Choices.
print_description: This event is an open-forum discussion hosted by academics and intellectuals interested in Burning Man regarding the use of ritual in BRC, 1986-2011.

title: 5 Energetic Intelligences & The Gifts They Offer
description:
NSA is a Re-Organizational Healing model that promotes strategies for living. We are moving away from the era of the Humpty Dumpty model: put everything back together again before "the event happened". We are finding this model no longer serves us as much as it hinders us from our Soul's Growth. In Re-Organizational Healing we find ourselves embracing " A Rite of Passage" with the experiences that enrich our lives and catapult us from the caterpillar in a cocoon to unleashing our Vitality as the Beautiful Butterfly! What if you knew how to access the gifts of all your "traumatic experiences" and transmute them into Aliveness?! Align your Body-Mind-Soul with enlivening tools to access your most profound sacred gifts to share with the world! It all starts by living in an organized structure that is congruent energetically and utilizes your strengths (gifts) Effortlessly! 

We will be discussing the 5 energetic layers of the body: Life force, Emotional, lower & upper Mental, Soul, Spirit. We will explain how each of these layers relates to the spine and the gifts that each one brings and how you can access these gifts now. We will be giving a demonstration of the work and give you a Somatic Respiratory Integration Exercise to take home with you!
print_description: 5 Energetic Intelligences & The Gifts They Offer

title: Aerialist Invite!

Carnival del Fuego is erecting a 18 foot tall 3 frequency dome designated for aerialist performance.  We are a day time camp, drop by any time before sunset and one of our aerialists will set you set up in the dome.  

We have a silk to share, or feel free to bring your own equipment along.

title: Afterglow

Find some glow MOOP?  Bring it here!

title: Afternoon Delight
description: The Cabana Club - A favorite vacation spot for the citizens of Black Rock City. The Black Rock Cabana Club is an oasis of hospitality and friendship. We serve up a refreshing array of nosh and cocktails for your Afternoon Delight. Come relax in our cabanas or take a "swim" in our pool, an 800 sq ft misted shade structure. Our after hours line up includes a chill DJ spinning in our spa, a nightly theme, and sunrise mimosas.
print_description: Come enjoy a refreshing array of nosh and cocktails for your Afternoon Delight at The Cabana Club - Black Rock Cities newest vacation destination.

title: Aikido as Alchemy
description:
Come have a unique experience of Aikido as a transformational process of self development. Lighthearted, all are welcome.

The class is rather non-martial, emphasizing connection, ground, and center. From deepening into the practice- how do these principals change and expand? who are you as you fill more space? what does this say about development? Anyone is welcome, and the atmosphere is light hearted.

No falling typically. No striking techniques at any point. Very simply movements more designed as self reflection tools and for development then for martial purpose.
print_description: Come have a unique experience of Aikido as a transformational process of self development. Lighthearted, all are welcome.

title: Alchemy Gender Workshop Sunny @ Rites Of Zion
description:
Intention:

The intention and purpose of the Alchemical Gender Circle is to increase understanding of the experiences we have as men and women, both with ourselves and with one another. This is facilitated by enhancing the capacity to listen to another’s experience and creating an intentional space in which we feel open to communicate our feelings. This was developed by me and influenced by the work of Avrom Altman. I have facilitated the circle in many diverse groups of people. Everyone from addicts in resident rehabilitation, parents of autistic children to art collectives and urban family tribes.

Process:

The process of the circle is in three phases. I am present to act as group facilitator and therapist. During the first phase, the women of the group gather to form a circle. The men in the group hold and contain them by forming a concentric circle around the women. Then the women are given the opportunity to speak about how they feel about

·   Introduce themselves and what brought them here

·   Their gender roles, both in their families and society.

·   What romance and dating/partnerships means to them

·   What they wish the men in their lives understood about them

The men are silent as they listen to the women’s process.

During the second phase, the roles are reversed. Without comment, the men and women exchange places and the men move to the center circle and the women hold the space in a circle around them. The men speak about their gender roles and the women in their lives as the women listen to the men’s process.

In Phase 3, both the women and men gather in one large circle and speak about what the experience was for them.
print_description: Work with intention to increase understanding of the experiences we have as men and women, both with ourselves and with one another, Sunny Strasburg

title: Amazing radio on 99.1FM, The BRBC
description:
The BRBC (99.1FM) is a 100% solar powered FM radio station that brings you the best music you'll hear on the playa. Broadcasting 24/7 from the RadioShaque(tm) in Fandango Village, we play everything from hiphop to oldies and every genre in between!
 ----- 
Tired of ultra-supertrance-minimal-megathump-beatbreak-housecore? The BRBC plays a welcome mix of music with instruments such as: DRUMS! GUITARS! PIANOS! VOCALISTS! It's a regular cavalcade of awesome music, played strictly for your listening pleasure.
 ----- 
Want to try your hand at being a DJ? Come by the station and play your own jams! We'll show you how to run the board and sound like a real radio professional. Bring your iPod or a CD with MP3s on it and program your own real live radio show.
 ----- 
If being on-air isn't your thing, come grab a sticker to show your friends how incredibly cool and cutting edge you are. They'll know who's boss when you're sporting your flashy BRBC schwag!
 ----- 
Want to sit around and chuckle with your friends? Get up early-ish and listen to the morning-ish show. Laugh along with our hilarious DJs as we lay out the day's events and relentlessly mock people we disagree with!
 ----- 
Stay tuned all day and night to fill your hear-holes with the best stuff since pickles on the playa.
 ----- 
Our 7th year broadcasting is going to be our best yet, so don't miss a full week of audio hijinks - tune your radio to 99.1FM and break off the knob.
 ----- 
99.1 FM - The BRBC - Black Rock Broadcasting Corporation - 100% solar powered radio.
print_description: Tune in all week for the best radio on the playa! Music that spans all genres. On the air 24/7, and 100% solar powered! Touch that dial!

title: American Tribal Belly Dance Parade
description: Are you planning to wedge a 25-yard skirt into a compressor bag?  Got some moves and a hip scarf to back it up?  We will start from Camp Gypsies Tramps and Thieves for a parade of American Tribal Style improvisational belly dance and music all across the playa.  Aziza Nawal of Awalim, Brandy of Discordia Dance, and Banat Almeh sisters Christy Anandaconda, Theresa, Monet, and Nancy Dawn are hauling their zills all the way from Atlanta, GA and Greenville, SC to break it down with you, Original Gangster style.  All skill levels welcome—check out our class if you’d like to learn beforehand!  We also welcome musicians, art cars, children, and enthusiastic audience participants to join our retinue.

title: A New Paradigm for Spirituality
description: A New Paradigm for Spirituality:  In a world where drug dealers call themselves shamans and meditation retreats are a hot singles scene, what will emerge as the common ground we can truly call sacred. Explore with leading thinkers Amber Lupton (co-founder of a world peace initiative), Michael Costurus (Lakota spiritualist and student of plant medicine in Peru), Jonathan Yudis (film maker / cosmic traveler), and John Taylor (business and intellectual marvel), where spirituality is headed, the requirements for our new spiritual models, and how the deep mystery of our existence is being shaped by our current cultural climate.
print_description: Explore where spirituality is headed and how the deep mystery of our existence is being shaped by our current cultural climate.

title: ART TOUR - Bicycles
description:
As a part of your Rites of Passage this year consider finding out more about the fantastic art projects at Burning Man!  

This informal bike tour is hosted by volunteers from the ARTery (on the Esplanade).  A curated group of art projects will be visited and discussed.  This tour will begin at 10:00 AM and run approximately 60-90 minutes.  The tours are flexible so feel free to join us on playa if you see a bunch of bikes traveling in a pack, or drop out if you want.

The tour starts promptly  at the bike racks across from the ARTery (on the Esplanade).  

Note that there are also ART TOUR - Guided Tour (search Playa Events), and self guided tours (paper copies) available at the ARTery.  

Most of the art on the playa is self-funded, so be sure to check out your favorite art projects on the Burning Man website now, and then help fund them or volunteer through their respective websites.  It takes every single one of us to make Burning Man happen...

title: Art of Belly Dance
description:
The art of belly dance,
aka Raks Sharqi or Middle Eastern Dance, has its roots in the ancient
eastern world and has continued to thrive not only in its birthplace
but in the west and beyond. Gypsies, Tramps and Thieves is proud to
have multi-award winning performer Aziza Nawal of Awalim on staff to
lead you through the fundamentals of Middle Eastern Dance. This class
will contain stretching, movement, technique and combinations. New to
this dance? You will be assisted by members of Banat Almeh. Advanced
dancers? Aziza has some exercises for you as well! The last part of
the class will be an improv jam session so you can work out your moves! Then if you still want more Aziza Nawal will lead a relaxing cool down to ground and center you before you are on your way.
print_description:
Experience the art of belly dance movement at Gypsies, Tramps and Thieves! This class features technique and
combinations for all levels.

title: ART TOUR - Guided Tour
description:
It's all about the ART projects and the fabulous ARTISTS and their teams who create them!

Ride in style on a bus/mutant vehicle as volunteers from the ARTery provide information on curated art pieces, as well as the Temple and The Man.

Guided Vehicle tours run Tue-Fri and begin at 11:00 AM at District Everywhere. Vehicle tours are meant for people with mobility issues -- seniors, pregnant women, people with ongoing or temporary disabilities, children, and others who might face challenges in getting out and around the playa. You must have tickets in advance to get a seat on the bus.  Tickets are available @ noon THE DAY BEFORE at District Everywhere (Esplanade near the ARTery).  

Note that Wednesday's tour is a special children's tour, and the tour on Thursday is a special "Meet the Artists" tour.

Also note that there are separate ART TOUR - Bicycles (search Playa Directory), as well as self-guided (paper) tours available at the ARTery (on Esplanade)

title: Ayla Nereo Accoustic Set
description: Ayla Nereo sings her lyrical folk music, weaving words and infectious melodies into a cocoon of brilliant light and cozy atmosphere. It will sink you deeply into your self, and lift your heart wide open. Ayla Nereo came from the hills of Sonoma County, a child grown on blackberries and books. The lines of vision and waves of hearing brushed her shoulder one day, and it started to come out as music.Some say it sounds like Joni Mitchell and Buffy Saint-Marie having tea with Feist. Some say it’s like teleportation into the mind’s eye of what could be, if we choose it. Some dance. Hear for yourself.Keep an eye to the sky and an ear to the sounds around… There is a revolution of conscious hearing, a casting-off of bitter judgment, and it’s in your eyes…
print_description: Ayla Nereo sings her lyrical folk music, weaving words and infectiousmelodies into a cocoon of brilliant light and cozy atmosphere.

title: Bacchanal
description: Gods, Goddesses, Satyrs, Nymphs, mythical creatures of all kind: revel in the Roman rite of Bacchanal, and then frolic with us to the Trojan Horse. Dress in character or your best Roman finery and join us for ritualistic debauchery. Then, at sunset, we march to the Esplanade where the masses will pull a 20-ton Trojan Horse from the Esplanade through the Gates of Troy and into the Temple of Dionysius, where it will be consumed by a spectacular conflagration.

description: Come to the Badlands and get down with some greasy individuals. It will be a freestyle funk explosion. Instruments will be set up in the mighty Badlands FunkDome to make you bend your neck, crook your hooks and shake your heels like a mystical chinchilla horde was attacking your feets. If you have an instrument to bring, bring it! If you have an amp, even better! We will have power and some amplification available. If you're a DJ and want to jam with live musicians, come through. Acoustic noise makers are always welcome. We always want more rad drummers. Various drums and percussion will be set up and microphones will be available for singers and wordsmiths. All instruments and musical styles are welcome in the Land of Badness.  Join in the menagerie! Pure Funk Conquers ALL!!! Libations will be made available. Get some! BADLANDS (not bad meaning bad but bad meaning good)

title: Bare Humanity Nude Portraiture
description:
Have your nude portrait taken as part of an on-going photographic project. Each participant gets a free 11x14 silver print in the mail. Couples and groups are particularly encouraged. This year I will be shooting only between hours of 4 and 7PM.  Please be patient if I am already working with someone when you arrive.  I will give you my card and take your email and postal address information.  Your print will arrive in the mail within several weeks to two months of the event; hand-printed gelatin silver prints are a very laborious process! Please don't wear clothes with tight rubber bands to the shoot, as we'll have to wait for the lines to disappear.

Please note that the idea is not as much to document Burning Man as to take a portrait of you set in the gorgeous desert.  Therefore, I will probably ask you to remove such things as glitter, body paint and temp. tattoos.  BUT PLEASE BRING PROPS!  Dead animals, unusual (but not ravey) clothes, gas masks, medieval armor, etc.   

If you'd like to assist me on this project, please get in touch ahead of time.  I am looking for an assistant familiar with photographic process.  Your ticket is on me.
print_description: Have your nude portrait taken as part of an on-going photographic project. Each participant gets a free 11x14 silver print in the mail. Bring props!

title: basics of Karen Burmese Massage
description: Karen Burmese healing techniques treat the person as a whole, and teach the practitioner the use of proper body mechanics and efficient energy use. This ancient tradition is nowadays cloaked by either Christianity or Buddhism but was originally an animistic tradition and still has many of animistic characteristics. It's a very unique approach to massage and energy work that is extremely rare in the US.

title: Beatles At Noon
description: Come Together and get your daily musical fix with Pepperland...a four-seven piece band of professional musicians dedicated to the faithful and fun-loving live reproduction of the greatest band ever - The Beatles! Fronted by a Brit, backed by top-notch players, Pepperland gets audiences up and dancing (and often singing along) to songs even the Beatles never performed live. Playafied from their 2010 performances at Bman's Reverbia...this popular shade-stage scene hob nobbed a diverse population of Burners including: international, youth to old school...freak, geek, and fashion chic, tribal and hippie, pink pride and red neck Burners etc. etc. Because deep within our musical core...this common thread unites us...Everyone loves some Beatles some time. So come and be an honorary member of The Seargent Peppers Lonely Hearts Club Band!! Beatles at Noon...Tues-Saturday!! Reverbia.
print_description: Come Together and get your daily musical fix with Pepperland...Black Rock City's favorite Beatles reproduction band. 60+ song list and Brit frontman.

title: Beaver Yoga
description: So you want a good start to your day?  Then what a better way than Surya Namaskar with the Beavers? Please join CBGB in a 2,500 year old yogi tradition of honoring the sun, Surya Namaskar (Sun Salutation).  The Sanskrit word namaskar stems from namas, which means "to bow to" or "to adore."   Surya Namaskar, is a series of 12 postures performed in a single, graceful flow. Each movement is coordinated with the breath; Inhale as you extend and stretch, and exhale as you fold and contract. The Sun Salutation builds strength and increases flexibility while removing mental dirt, revitalizing your body, relieving stiffness and restoring balance.  This workshop is open to all individuals’ who possess a mat or towel, regardless of your experience.  See you on the playa, Namaste!
print_description: So you want a good start to your day? Then what a better way than Yoga with the Beavers?  This class is open to all. Bring mat or towel.

title: Beginning Aerial Lyra
description: Have you ever dreamed of becoming an aerialist, but sweaty palms, a belief that you’re not strong enough, or a fear of heights has kept your feet on the ground? Get a taste of the circus heights with this intro to aerial lyra class, suitable for beginners. Sometimes called an aerial hoop or circeau, the lyra is a padded steel hoop that will be hung from a 20' tall fiberglass traveling rig at Camp Gypsies, Tramps, and Thieves.  After a thorough warm-up and discussion of strengthening exercises with Christy Anandaconda, you’ll get to take your turn in the air! Exhilaration and laughter guaranteed. Pants or leggings recommended; sobriety required.  “Some kind of pants are an excellent idea; ten-yard skirts and inversion are a humorous but ineffectual combination.” ~Sadie

title: DJ Jocelyn
description:
Since the dawn of time men and women have been enraptured by the sacred dance, spiraling into the heights of ecstacy and submerging into the depths of soulful bliss. By communing with the vixen within, she channels this energy, adds some sub-bass and creates a gypsy infused sauce of luscious whomp. Like a soft caress down the back of your neck, delicate twinklings of sultry highs lull dancers into a sonic womb, only to be enticed back into throbbing convulsions by another of her glitched out dubstep hip hop/gypsy infused bassy beats

Dj Jocelyn promises that she will increase the chance of your evening's coupling with that of sheer wild fun and yum. As the visionary co-founder and producer of Club Exotica she is sure to offer her sexy, gutteral, grinding, liquid-lithe mixes to lift the party's spirit ever higher. She drives your consciousness deep into your hips while furtive, cantankerous, sly, smiles blossom radiantly and dart from your eyes only to incorrigibly drape across your lips.
print_description: Dance to the awesome beats of DJ Jocelyn!

title: Black Rock City's Next Top Assassin
description:
Do you have what it takes to be BRC's Next Top Assassin? Join our playafied gotcha game. Pick up a game token and make your kills. 
Weapon is water gun or spray gun (must be non electric, manually triggered). Game operates during daylight hours and is a free for all between all citizens wearing game tokens (rather than assignment of specific targets). 
Killed players hand over their game token to their killer. Simultanous kills are possible if shots are fired before received. Additional tokens may be obtained if you are killed. Creativity may be required to do so.
The only permanent safe zone is within temple walls. We recommend you remove game tokens when visiting the temple to avoid ambushes in the temple area.
print_description: Want to be BRC's Next Top Assassin? Join our playafied, free for all version of gotcha. NOW WITH REINCARNATION! Get a game token to start your kills.

title: Black Rock Educators Constortium
description:
As educators, we all bring so much back to our classrooms from the playa.  The goal of BREC is to create a staff development opportunity unlike any other- where we help each other to bring the magic home to our students.  Teach a breakout session!  Collaborate on lesson plans!  Bring home a slick flyer to prove to your administration that the art festival you missed the first week of school to go to is semi-legitimate!

Registration is at noon on Wednesday; pick up a session listing and check out the break-out board!

All educators are welcome; Early-childhood ed, K-12, higher ed, adult ed, certificated, classified, administrative, whatever!  We all have something to share.
print_description: Join fellow edu-burners in a staff development unlike any other.  Registration is at noon on Weds-pick up a detailed session listing then!

title: Black Rock Film Festival
description:
The second annual Black Rock Film Fest will be presented by the Boston Underground Film Festival and the Engine Theater. Our open air theater will showcase the best short films from around the world to an international audience of art and film lovers who descend on Burning Man each year for fun, art, and experience in the Nevada desert.

Black Rock Film Fest 2011 will kick off with a Red Carpet Opening Night Gala before the first program on Tuesday night and conclude with a Wrap Party after the last films on Friday night. Before every screening we will host a cocktail hour at our Casting Couch Bar. The Black Rock Film Fest will also host a live performance from The Zebbler Encanti Experience. 

The Black Rock Film Fest (formerly known as BRC International Film Festival) began as a collaboration between SF IndieFest and BUFF, the organizations responsible for the annual San Francisco Independent Film Festival, SF Documentary Film Fest, Another Hole in the Head, and the Boston Underground Film Festival. The organizers have collectively produced over 40 film festivals.
print_description: 4 days of international short & music videos projected on the Engine Theater- 1000 pound light and steel sculpture portable cinema. After parties too!

title: Black Rock Solar Summit
description: Since 2007, Black Rock Solar has been building solar arrays in Nevada and giving them away at little or no cost. We have built over 1.4 million watts of clean renewable energy in Northern Nevada to date! BRS prioritizes installations for schools, hospitals, rural communities, non-profit groups, and Native American tribes. We’ve also teamed up with other environmental organizations in GREENevada to provide student education and teacher support.  At our 2011 Solar Summit, you will meet the staff and crew of Black Rock Solar as well as other Burners doing meaningful and innovative work around the country. Tell us about your projects and learn about ours. The purpose of this event is to bring together all of the different groups and individuals on playa doing work in renewable energy, climate change, environmental outreach and policy.  Join us for a cold beer, fresh mint julep, live music, and update from the new Executive Director of Black Rock Solar, Paddy McCully.
print_description: Have a cold mint julep, learn about our projects, tell us what you're doing in the world of renewable energy, climate change & environmental outreach.

title: Black Rock Warriors
description: Come take sides in a week-long Black Rock gang war! New recruits are welcome any time, and will be initiated through unique rites of passage and get to choose squirt guns and different-colored bandannas signifying their clan membership. Throughout the week, potentially hundreds of warriors will be encouraged to hunt members of rival clans (identified by their prominently displayed bandanas) all across the playa, working independently or taking part in large pre-scheduled shoot-outs. Black Rock warriors killed by the opposing gangs must sign their killers' bandanas to signify the coup, and remain dead until they resurrect that night at sunset--unless they perform a mutually-agreed-upon service for their killer (such as a funny dance, a gift of food or alcohol, or something crazier), in which case they resurrect immediately. Band together with your friends and get to know your enemies as you hunt complete strangers throughout the week! Nowhere is safe, unless you take off your bandana--but then you can't shoot anyone either, and who wants that? Hunt for favors, to meet new people, to have your victory recorded in the camp's log book, or for the sheer honor of the kill!
print_description: Come get initiated into one of several warrior clans, receive your squirt gun and bandana, then hunt rival warriors for honor and glory all week long!

title: Bobby Wheelock's Administrative Fun Pack
description:
Bobby Wheelock,  everyone's favorite Nazi Hitler clone from Brazil,  wants to give all participants on the playa their own individualized fun pack.  And we will need volunteers to help distribute these fun packs.

Bobby is a person who's DNA is cloned from a prominent German political figure who rose to fame in the 1930's.  Unlike his forefather,  Bobby loves and embraces Burning Man and has no xenophobic tendencies.  That being said.  Bobby wants to use his Charisma and swiss gold to gain control of Burning Man (oh no!).  Bobby came up with an administration pack to keep everyone in order. 
Luckily, Bobby's Blond Japanese triplet sexrataries did not like the plot and "influenced" us to modify the wording and put the "fun" into these flyers.

Each of the 50,000 flyers will be individualized for every participant,  and will have a bunch of games and jokes to go around.

As a bonus, a new religious movement is included, And there even is a special coupon to help with decommodification.

In order to deliver all these 50,000 fliers,  we will need 32 volunteers Wednsday at 9:00, located around the rim of the city.  After this,  everyone who wants to play should yell out "Gold for Goldie!" - which is the secret code.

And yes,  there are a select number of "Golden Tickets".

Legal Eagleez:
This is a good leave no trace giveaway,  as the 9 miles of flyers are easy to pick up.   Overt corporate sponsorship is kept to a minimum,  and no-one has the guts to claim this as a tax write-off.  Bobby is a fictional character from the 1977 movie "Boys from Brazil",  but his sexretaries are real.  Goldie is a woman who has gifted love,  and should be gifted back all the gold in the universe.
print_description: Bobby Wheelock,  a Nazi Hitler clone from Brazil,  wants to give everyone on the playa their own individualized fun pack. 50000! Gold For Goldie!

title: Body, Mind, Heart, Spirit
description: Body / Mind / Heart / Spirit: We Need Integration for Our Survival:  Experts say that if we do not turn our current global trajectory around in the next four years, it will become 1000 times more difficult to do so. It's apparent that we cannot rely on the hirearchical systems that created the mess we're in to solve the problem. How do we shift the seemingly unstoppable, markedly unconscious, and appallingly unsustainable direction of our human race - now?  Our only hope is the emergence of a well-functioning, self-organizing human system where the body, mind, heart, and spirit are awakened.  Join Raj Sundra (social entrepreneur), John Taylor (business and intellectual marvel), Allison Coleman (transformational educator), Michael Costurus (Lakota spiritualist and student of plant medicine in Peru), and Kim Iglinsky (one of the Bay Areas premier EFT trainers and formerly a prominent Israeli runway model) in a panel discussion on how to cause the rapid emergence of an integrated human system to source the creation of a sustainable, just and fulfilling world for all.
print_description: Join us to discuss how we shift the seemingly unstoppable, markedly unconscious, and appallingly unsustainable direction of our human race.

title: Bondage & Movement
description:
Come explore movement and dance while partially bound in rope---by yourself or to a partner.

‘Investigating Tension’ could be the theme of this exercise.  Each of our bodies has its own gait, its own pace and memory.  Our bodies hold a certain preference of movement, a style of movement.  These inherent inclinations in our muscles and nerves can be brought forth into conscious light when our limbs and their range of motion is partially constricted with rope.  New channels of energy can open up in our system when this happens.  New ways of moving and expressing can present themselves.

Rope also contains an inherently erotic element.  This can be fun to play with as well.

Come play and explore.  Have fun.  By yourself---or bound to another.
print_description: Come explore movement and dance while partially bound in rope---by yourself or to a partner.

title: BookCrossing Zone
description: The Playa has a BookCrossing Zone! Come pick up a Book, or drop one off! All books will be given a special sticker and journal entry that they have been to Black Rock City!! If you have a special book that celebrates one of your "Rites of Passage" Bring it to the BookCrossing Zone so it can continue to travel the world, touching others lives. BookCrossers are a lot like Burners, there are over 900,000 of us, in 132 different countries. Since 2001 we have registered over 8 million books! Always free! Our goal is to turn the world into a free lending library. You keep a bookcrossing book as long as you like, then give it to someone else, take it to a BookCrossing Zone, or release it "into the Wild" to be found by someone who will want to read it! You can check out BookCrossing at www.bookcrossing.com I am "Fuzzmom" feel free to check out my shelf and profile.
print_description: Come drop off a special (or not so special) Book,or pick one up! BookCrossers and Non-BookCrossers alike are welcome! Make the world a free Library!

title: BOOTIE BRC: AutoSub
description:
OMG MUSIC WITH WORDS! Bastard pop insanity! For six years, A Plus D – aka DJs Adrian & Mysterious D, along with Malderor, have brought BOOTIE BRC, the internationally-infamous mashup bootleg party, to Black Rock City! 

Launched in San Francisco in 2003, Bootie was the first club night in the United States dedicated solely to the burgeoning artform of the bootleg mashup -- and is now the biggest mashup event in the world, with regular parties in several cities on four continents. Keeping your brain guessing and body dancing with crazy and creative song combinations, Bootie's DJs celebrate -– and satirize -– the many different genres of music. 

Bootie mixes and matches every conceivable musical genre, era, and style into one big dance party where everyone feels welcome. It’s a place where all sounds, cultures, and sexualities can unite on the dance floor, providing the soundtrack for the A.D.D. generation ... and with free mashup CDs given away like candy!

This will also be the after-party/reception for Mr. & Mrs. Z! Come celebrate their union!
print_description: OMG MUSIC WITH WORDS! Bastard pop insanity! Free CDs! A Plus D & Malderor bring the international mashup bootleg party to BRC, turning 2 songs into 1.

description: Join Carrie and live drummers for an ecstatic African rhythmic experience that will make you move! We will learn traditional celebration dance sequences from West Africa. All levels welcome, dust or shine! Carrie is a devotee and lover of movement and embodiment in all forms. She is a certified Hatha Yoga teacher and has taught yoga and West African drumming and dance workshops around the world. Carrie has studied with master teachers in Guinea, Mali, and the US, and lives in the San Francisco Bay Area.

title: Bound States
description:
This is not a beginning rope class, but rather the beginning of the discussion on what to with a lover once you have them all roped and bound.  Why tie someone up?  What becomes available through bondage?  What mental states, physical states, sensual possibilities open up once a person is bound?  What journeys open up that are otherwise less accessible?

We will explore these possibilities through discussion as well as some playful rides and exercises.  What might you discover about yourself on this ride, whether you are the one wearing the rope or the one weaving it.

Please come to participate and share.
print_description: Why tie someone up?  What mental, physical, sensual possibilities open up once a person is bound? Explore through discussion and playful exercises.

Please stop by and say hello.

title: Brain Wave Escape
description:
When the sun begins to set and you’re ready to relax stop by Boo Boo City and escape with the help of light and sound.  You will sit back in chair and place a pair of sun glasses that will have LEDs on the inside of the lens.  The LEDs are bright and are not meant to be stared into; you actually keep your eyes closed. Don’t worry; you control the light intensity so it’ll never be too bright or too dim.

Along with the light comes sound.  The lights will be pulsing at different brain frequencies.  The sound will be paired with the lights.  You basically sit back, relax and let yourself escape into a completely relaxed state.  The entire experience lasts 20 minutes, however you are free to stop at any time.  Look to the ski for the lights, follow them to Boo Boo City.
print_description: Light and sound pulses at different brain wave frequencies will put you in a relaxed stated.  Come kick your feet up for a few and escape.

title: ~ Bras of Passage ~ (DIY Ritual)
description:
Society never gave us a ceremony or ritual for bras, so we're making our own. I'm wandering as the Bra Shaman daily on the playa. Join us as we dance scream shake yell and possibly even convulse with the Holy Bra Spirit. Whether you loathe bras, love bras, wear bras, or don't wear bras--come and express yourself! All genders welcome.
 We'll have extra bras for you. If you feel like donating bras for this event, check out the website & send me an email. Feel free to send me any pictures after the Burn, & I'll put it on the blog!
print_description: Bring bras (or not!) & dance scream shimmy parade the playa. Society never gave us a ritual so we're doing our own. We've got bras. ALL GENDERS!

title: BRC Naked Pub Crawl
description:
All Burning Man citizens are invited to the 8th running of the BRC Naked Bicycle Pub Crawl.  

If you're a first-timer, here's the drill:  we meet at the Man and have a cocktail or two.  Then we ride off on a meandering tour of the city.  Six host camps along the route will keep the icy cocktails flowing.

We’ll have mugs for the first 300 riders but bring a cup just in case.

Our host camps this year will be Comfort & Joy, Barbie Death Camp & Wine Bistro, Celestial Bodies, Tribe, The Duck Pond, and the Naked Tiki Bar.

Sunshine, alcohol, and blatant public nudity...  It’s a playa tradition!  Find us on Facebook at http://www.facebook.com/event.php?eid=147170995353172

title: Brian Travis
description:
"It’s not every day that a club owner sets his bar on fire to celebrate a great performance from a visiting band, but that’s just what happened when The BTB rocked the Isla Cantina. As the band dove into the Burning Man-themed crowd favorite “Gasoline,” a row of flame whipped across the top of the bar.
“We were firing on all cylinders that night,” says singer & guitarist Brian Travis. “The place was packed & we were charged up. Our best shows don’t just rely on execution. They happen when we’re playing with great energy and the kind of momentum that pushes rock 'n roll forward, tapping into the spirit of the music itself.”
Travis, Mark Wickliffe (drums) & Steve Wiel (bass) effortlessly mix classic rock with twangs of country & hints of the blues, giving traditional folk melodies a unique rock and roll vibe. With 5 albums of original content released, the core group of Travis, Wickliffe & Wiel continues to wow Los Angeles crowds with their own brand of heartfelt rock n roll.
“The BTB show is real,” says Wiel. ” There is nothing staged, nothing scripted, hell, sometimes we don’t even have a setlist. Each show is like no other & you never know what’s going to happen.”
The BTB has worked hard to earn its place as a Los Angeles mainstay, & with plans for future material & an upcoming tour already in the works, the band won’t be taking a break anytime soon. There is simply too much burning passion in the band’s driven frontman. “We’re exploring all these different sides of ourselves right now,” Travis explains. “We’re planning to record an album with the country sound we’ve been exploring lately. But after that, we’re going to get back to the rock stuff– because that’s truly what’s in my heart.” - Erin Johnson, June 2010
print_description: Acoustic singer songwriter performance

title: Brighten Up with Color Therapy
description:
Color therapy by Masae Satouchi, Color-therapist/ Personal Colorist/ NPO Japanese color language colorful color association (NY artistic director. The theme: I <3 Color! Being colorful is not a crime, but if it was I'd be a fugitive baby. Learn how to use color as a universal language and powerful psychological tool. I will share and discuss color knowledge and culture with you. The world can be healed through color language.My goal is to bring color and joy to the World.

Dress code: Wear your favorite color. 

We want to hear about your opinion of color and your culture. So come sit with us in our Om Dome, sip some water or tea, tell us your favorite color and why you love it so. Let us help you realize your full color potential. Photo shoot to follow:)
print_description: Being colorful is not a crime, but if it was I'd be a fugitive baby. Learn how to use color as a universal language and powerful psychological tool.

Following on this years theme, Rites of Passage, we seek to honor the process of engagement and separation through personal expression of a hand made piece of jewelry.

title: BR Scouts / EG Trash Fence Trip
description: Calling all Black Rock Scouts to join us to learn about the trash fence for a MOOP investigation! Come learn about Black Rock City's first trash fence, the stuff we find these days, and where today's trash came from and what could have prevented its escape.  Kids welcome!
print_description: Join us on a MOOP investigation! Come learn about BRC's first trash fence,the stuff we find these days, and how to best trap it! - for Kids!

title: Brunch "House"
description: Are you missing those moments of listening to that light fluffy house music while eating your brunch and drinking mimosas in that trendy restaurant? Well head over to Shadyvil for Brunch house. We'll have the seats and the beats to match the eats, all you need to do is dress the part. Be sure to dress for the occasion in your most stylish and trendy brunch attire, as there will be a bouncer regulating entry. Only the most stylish Brunchers will be allowed to enter inside our exclusive Cafe Shad. DJ's for this event will feature San Francisco's own Fedora. They will be inviting some friends to help create the hip soundtrack that you can enjoy your delicious and stylish brunch to. Who says you can't have stylish brunch on the playa?
print_description: Come enjoy brunch in the trendiest restaurant the playa has to offer. Dress to impress! Who says you can't have stylish brunch on the playa?

title: Bubbles and Bass
description:
We'll be rockin' you out from 4am til 11am with bubbly bass-tastic house music as you watch the sunrise over the playa and dance the AM hours away... and drink some bubbly while you boogie.

We want to create a home of warmth and positive energy during the AM hours. Together with a team of artists, musicians, circus performers, dancers, planners, bartenders, builders, architects, thinkers, dreamers, and lovers, we are going to bring invigorating house music to the Burning Man community and a dance floor that gets everyone moving and shaking.  We'll offer you hookah and champagne to relax and a comfy chill space to enjoy the sounds while resting your feet after a night of partying. We want to provide an environment conducive to connecting: spiritually, conversationally, and energetically.
print_description: Come dance the AM hours away to bubbly bass-tastic house music while enjoying a glass of bubbly. Relax and connect in our hookah lounge.

title: Bubbles and Bass Sunrise Circus
description: Come enjoy, play, and learn with hula hoops, juggling balls, clubs, scarves, diabolos, devil sticks, poi, stavs, and spinning plates as the sun rises over the Playa. As the bass is pumpin, and bubbly is flowing, we welcome those who have just awoken or arrived from the nights magical adventures. Come ready to PLAY! Come move your body in dance and toy manipulation; lets create a kaleidoscope of color and movement. Everyone can be involved in Sunrise Circus, as visual recipient, skill sharer, learner, or performer. This is an all inclusive initiative to bring a circus experience to people of all abilities shapes sizes and functional mental states. We will have guest teachers running workshops as well as roving circus instruction to help people learn some fun tricks.
print_description: Come enjoy, play, and learn with hula hoops, juggling balls, clubs, scarves, diabolos, devil sticks, poi, stavs, and spinning plates.

title: Burlesque: Bump & Grind Intro
description:
Candy Pie will teach you some of the basic burlesque moves to get your ass shaking, boobs spinning and tassels twirling. Learn the shimmy, bump and grind, hip swivel, stance, finger gestures.

Work with props or just your playa wear. Bring a positive attitude and lots of water. Wear comfortable clothes that you can easily remove. Layers are best. Optional ideas to bring: gloves, zippered clothes, stretchy items, scarves, umbrellas, parasols. Tassels will be provided to pin to clothing or bring your own.

Both sexes allowed. Nudity is at the option of the student. Photos not allowed.

title: Burner Food Magic and Playa Chefs’ Roundtable
description: Join your fellow Burner Foodies (as opposed to food burners) to swap stories, sources, and strategies for creating your own moveable feast in the desert. We’ll discuss recipes, kitchen set-ups, equipment, sanitation, and everything related to cooking in this challenging environment for a couple or crowd. This is your chance to connect with those who love to nourish their fellow campmates and citizens of BRC.  The Roundtable will also be the beginnings of a forum for playa chefs to keep in touch throughout the year!  Whether you are new to Playa cooking or have been kitchen-witching for years, come share a toque with us!   And if you’re feeling like showing off your cooking chops, bring your favorite playa-inspired dish to share with others!
print_description: Swap strategies for your moveable feast in the desert. We’ll discuss recipes, sourcing, equipment, sanitation and stuff related to playa cooking.

title: Burner Parents of Burners
description:
Being a Burner parent of a Burner is one of the most remarkable experiences to be had at Burning Man. Come share with fellow parents the good and bad news. How has your relationship changed from your shared experiences? How do you explain it to your neighbors when you return from the desert?  Are your children toddlers? Teenagers? Adults?  Is it what you thought it would be?  Are you worried sick? Do you need support and recognition yourself?  Do you just need a stiff drink?
Special gold stars and brownie points if you bring pictures of your children.  AND a special recognition if your grandchildren are on the playa.
Bring your favorite Bordeaux or drink our cheap whiskey. BYOCup.
print_description:
Are you a parent of a current Burner?  Come by and celebrate with fellow
parents.  Bring your favorite Bordeaux or drink our cheap whiskey. BYOCup.

title: Burners of the world

title: Burning All Year Round
description:
A group of Heebee Geebee Healers wanted more of their lives to be filled with playa love and service. We’ve opened a healing center and school, the Blue Morpho Center for Transformation in Puerto Viejo, Costa Rica. (Our blog is BlueMorphoCenterNews.wordpress.com). We intend it to be the first of several such Centers around the world. Learn how we did it. Talk about how you may turn a playa dream into reality. Maybe we'll find ways to support each other. We’ll answer questions about volunteering and internships at our Center too. 
It's OK to email questions to us before the Burn at BlueMorphoCenter@gmail.com
print_description: Some HeebeeGeebee Healers are doing playa love and service all year. Come hear how we started a Center. U can too. BlueMorphoCenterNews.wordpress.com

title: Burning Surivors: Walk to the Temple!
description:
We're Still Here! And we're going to celebrate every minute of it.
Burner cancer survivors, our friends and families: Join us in walking
from the man to the temple Wednesday night to cheer and smile and be
damn glad we're still here. And honor those who have passed. And give
very serious love to those of us still fighting every day to squeeze
every drop of joy out of life that we can. Because we cherish life like you
wouldn't believe. 

We're meeting at the MAN (facing the temple) at 9pm and walk to the
Temple. It has become a reunion of sorts. It's moving. It's happy.
It's celebratory. It's about love and life.

The tradition continues!
print_description: Cancer Surivivors, friends, loved ones CELEBRATE LIFE! Meet at the 12oclock side of the man, 9pm, and walk to the temple to honor the journey.

title: Burn Mitzvah Party
description: In honor of the Rites of Passage theme this year, a Burn Mitzvah party is being held at Party Naked Tiki Bar. Join our tongue-in-cheek homage to the age old Jewish rite of passage into adulthood (Must be 21 and over with ID). Sponsored by the "NYC Fetish Tribe", expect an irreverent event filled with fun twists. The Party Naked Rab-Bar will have Rabbis serving Manischewitz. Meet our authentic Jewish Mother, present to dispense guilt and advice whether you want it or not. Make your own Yamulkah or join in a game of Strip Dreidel (beloved Hanukkah game with an adult twist). We will dance the hora, a traditional folk dance commonly known to break out spontaneously during Jewish parties and escalate in speed and enthusiasm to the point of ecstasy.  During This celebratory circle dance, random revelers are pulled into the center of the circle, seated in chairs and hoisted in the air by other dancers. Sin City will infuse these age old customs with hedonism and humor and bring to the Playa a RITE OF PASSAGE we like to call THE BURN MITZVAH.
print_description: Join our tongue-in-cheek homage to the age old Jewish rite of passage. Rabbis serving Manischewitz, make your own Yamulkah, the hora and Strip Dreidel

title: Cache & Burn IV "Travelbugs of Passage"
description:
Huzzah! It's the 4th annual Cache & Burn event and group photo at the Man!!  On Thursday, September 1st, we'll meet at 10:03am at 6 o'clock and the MAN.  With that in mind, we are burners too and know that keeping track of time and space can be a huge challenge.  The Cache & Burn Banner/log book will be hanging on Faith's (Cookie & Faith) motorhome. If you stop by the BRCU (Black Rock Center for Unlearning) and sign the banner anytime during the week, you can claim this event. It's not very often that we get to meet Geocachers from all over the place in our neck of the woods.  What could be better than on a dusty playa in the Nevada desert? I can't think of anywhere I'd much rather be?
At least a couple of us will be wearing tie dyed T-shirts with Great Basin Eastern Sierra Geocachers in large white writing on the back.  We plan on meeting at the MAN for our annual group photo, trade travelbugs, pass out some schwag, and share our playa/geocaching stories.  Then...those that would like to join us, we'll be touring the C.O.R.E effigies as a group. As always, bring enough refreshments to keep yourself hydrated!
print_description: 4th annual Geocaching event & group photo at the MAN-6 O'clock side @ 10:03am sharp! After photo & stories, we'll tour the CORE effigies as a group.

title: Changing the Education Paradigm
description: Expert Panel - The Death And Rebirth Of Modern Education: 85% of college graduates last year got jobs that don’t require a degree, and the country has racked up more student loans than credit card debt.  Education is the way a culture invests in its future, but just like in the world of finance, our investment vehicle is severely broken.  Most experts agree the system will crumble under its own weight, but what will emerge to fill our human need to strive and better ourselves?  Engage in a dialog with Jennifer Russell and Bryan Franklin - cutting edge transformational educators, Danielle Strachman - director of Peter Thiel's "20 under 20" program, and other experts who answer the question, “What and how do we need to learn to be successful in a free world?”

title: Circumdecision
description:
Head in to our camp & choose your circumcision.  We apply a prosthetic foreskin and then remove it. No cutting or pain. Please arrive clean.

In our day and age it is normal and often assumed that all baby boys are to be circumcised. Circumcision in our culture is thrust on the baby before he is given a chance to choose this irreversible physical change. 
This one day event is an opportunity to choose and be completely aware of your rite of passage. Whether you have foreskin or not, all are welcome. Women are welcome to be a part of the ceremony as well.
The goal is to have a number of participants gather. Everyone has a chance to voice their personal feelings surrounding the subject of circumcision. (For example, any feelings of loss, resentment, thankfulness, hugeness, smallness, pain, joy, etc.) 
The goal is to reach a universal sense of awareness and for every man to be complete in himself whether cut or uncut. 
After the discussion, the foreskin awareness ceremony begins: (privately or publicly, his/her choice on an individual basis) the prosthetic foreskin will be introduced to the penis.
       A moment of recognition is experienced. (Can include but is not limited to incense, fanning with palm fronds, tears, prayers, chanting.) 
	The prosthetic foreskin is then painlessly peeled away, by choice and in full awareness.
	Each person gets to keep his/her own foreskin as a memento in an egg necklace.
print_description: Head in to our camp & choose your circumcision.  We apply a prosthetic foreskin and then remove it. No cutting or pain. Please arrive clean.

title: Community Currency Activists workshop
description:
One world currency camp is hosted by Joshua and the 1worldcurrency.net network. Join us in overturning the money changers tables.

1worldcurrency.net is a hub for a network of creators whose mission is the creation of a secure, ecologically sustainable, resource based, electronic, open source, transparent, interest free, fee free, money system / medium of exchange created by the people, for the people, available to every human on the Earth.

Take the technology and set ourselves free of usury.

1worldcurrency.net is a time, technology, and global resource exchange network and platform capable of exchange in thousands of different community currencies and interest free economies. It is a global language or alchemical solvent capable of delivering global citizenship to those who choose to use it.

May peace be with you,
Joshua

title: Compassionate Communication: Intercultural Couples
description: Come learn effective and compassionate techniques to explore and deepen communication channels across racial, cultural, religious, and language differences. Bring your/a partner for an experiential workshop filled with practical applications. The workshop will be led by Jose Luis and Tara, an inter-racial, cultural, religious,national, and language couple. Taller disponible en español.

title: Compassionate Connecting with James Prieto
description:
TUE A Taste of Compassionate Connecting: getting to know each other, experiencing our life energy in a group--what's alive in you and me--we get to feel the power of being known and experience a sense of connection and belonging.
 
WED Awareness: acknowledging our observations/judgments, feelings, needs and requests (OFNR). We get to focus our conscious awareness in the directions that we choose. By getting clear on OFNR, we develop competence to begin a journey into greater depths of our being.
 
THU Presence through Self-Empathy: several processes are introduced to help us to become consciously aware of our judgments, observations and the life energy within us. Through these processes, participants will gain valuable tools for self-connection, resulting in feelings of natural compassion, inner-peace and harmony.
 
FRI The Flow of Empathy: after we are self-connected, we now have some free energy to offer our presence and respectful listening to others. We aren't there to fix people, but to help them get clear with their own life energy. In this session, participants will gain practical knowledge of what is empathy and what is not--and will have opportunities to practice and get feedback.
 
SAT Spaceless-Timeless Presence of Empathetic Role Play: empathetic listening can help us to get clear with our pain relating to people who are not physically present. They may have passed on from this life, and we may have some unresolved hurts with them or others. The facilitator demonstrates the power of role plays with participant issues by taking on the spirit of their higher selves--in Christ consciousness.
print_description: Connect and integrate our hearts and minds to bring energy into conscious awareness, harmony into relationship, and Spirit into life. At RoP Dome.

title: Critical Tit/Critical Beaver after party
description:
Join us right after Critical Tits for cocktails in a safe women identified only environment.  Bring your own cup and relax with your female BRC lovelies.  

Camp Beaverton for Wayward Girls is your queer oasis in BRC.  Join us for an old fashioned Lesbian Mixer in the dessert.  We will play our version of Spin the bottle which we call Spin the monkey.  Meet your future ex-playa girlfriend in a friendly, safe sexy space.  Our dome is women-identified 24/7. Bring your own cup. 


"Camp Beaverton: Camp for Wayward Girls" is an intentional (and experimental) Burning Man community camp AND conversation. For who? For Gay and Queer Women (identified), Dykes, Bykes, Sluts, Butches, Bois, Trannies, Lesbians, Geekster-Hip Lezzies, Lesbos, Lipstick Lesbians, the Bi-identified, the Bi-curious, the Hetero-flexible, and even (gasp!) the occasional Straight Girl (as long as she's as Wayward as the playa is dusty). We are thouroughly queer, yet inclusive, with a definite chick-centric bent. Participation, inquiry, conversation, and owning your stuff are the name of the game.

Our intention is to provide two things: a kick-ass Queer Oasis in Black Rock City for girls who LOVE girls, and a continuing conversation exploring female and feminine queer sexuality in the world and in BRC. Participatory in nature, Camp Beaverton, whether online or on the Playa, is a place where you are encouraged to explore YOUR expression of queerness and allow the rest of us to ask "What is MINE?"
print_description: Beaverton welcomes all the lovely ladies from Critical Tits to the Beaver Den for a post-Critical Tits party. No shirt-cockers/cameras. Women only

Meet at the man at 4:00 pm for a topless bicycle ride, followed by a time to connect with your sweet, fellow-riders and to take in the magic of what can only happen at Burning Man.
Come with your girl friends if you can.  Ride for all your own reasons.  Rejoice in YOU.

title: Cuban Salsa Rueda Dance Jam @ RhythmWave
description:
Salsa Rueda de Casino

Rueda simply means "wheel". Casino refers to a place offering and live music and a place to dance.

Salsa Dancing. Salsa is a style of music and dance that breaths rhythm and movement into one. Its origin expands from Afro Cuban/ Caribbean/ Latin American beat and culture.

What makes Rueda unique is that the dancing is done in the "wheel", as a group, with a “caller” who determines the moves to been done at any giving time. Each move, or "call", has a name. After entering the circle (ideally with a partner, but not 100% necessary,) the leaders advance to the next follower in the wheel after a move or two is performed. This rapid changing of partners makes for a fun and friendly exchange all within the time of one song.

Many of the moves also have hand signals as well as names, in order to be able to dance in a loud club setting. The Rueda can be as small as two couples, or as large as a space can hold — as many as a hundred couples. When the circle to too large for the space, concentric circles may be formed.

When dancing Rueda, there is a new group dynamic that happens. What is not obvious when watching Rueda, is the new level of awareness required to have a group dance flow smoothly, and look sharp AND keep it fun! Dancers learn to open their sphere of awareness, their peripheral vision, beyond the normal restricted "bubble" of solo or partner dancing. In this way, dancers coordinate and adjust their individual feel and timing and style so as to make the Rueda "click". When this happens, it is very exciting indeed!

Guest teacher - Doug Dirt of the French Maid Brigade
print_description: Doug Dirt of the French Maid Brigade call on all salsitos & salseros to circle up &  have a swirlin sweet time dancin' yer passage w/Cuban Salsa Rueda

title: Cuddle Ocean!
description: Be a part of the largest display of affection in the history of earth – come to Cuddle Ocean! At sunset on the Playa this summer, a Cuddle Ocean will spill from the Man to the Temple, avoiding roads. Mermaids, pirates, jellyfish, sharks, penguins, octopus, fish, whales, and dolphins come home! Art cars are invited to form a musical perimeter around the event! We’ll have hot Cuddle Watch Lifeguards with megaphones to ensure no one drowns. Be prepared with a blanket/towel, water, sunscreen and a headlamp. Get ready for motorboats, surfing, deep sea diving and of course cuddles. Contact us if you want to become a certified Cuddle Watch Lifeguard.
print_description: Be part of the largest display of affection in the history of earth! 6-8pm cuddle from the man to the temple with mermaids, pirates and sea creatures!

title: Daily Costume Giveaways
description: Kostume Kult has been "costuming the naked" since 2002 from our Esplanade Kostume Dome every day from Tuesday through Saturday Noon til 5pm-ish. Acquired over the past year from generous costume companies and burners around the world who recycle their past glory with love, we have over 1 ton of costumes to give away, all free (no barter or returns required) but note that you MUST wear what you take and walk the runway to be reborn onto the playa with a new look and attitude. It is important to note that, in line with BM's decommodification, gifting and immediacy principles, Kostume Kult's costume giveaway dome is not about giving products but empowering experiences. It is true that the sight of a dome full of free costumes makes eyes dilate, pulses quicken and drooling has been known to occur, but we request that you fight the consumerist urge to "acquire"-- to grab armfuls of stuff, to scurry away with thoughts of future times to wear or how there are others you want to supply. Instead we suggest that you stay in the moment, put something on that makes you feel special and that if you find something absolutely perfect and you see someone else admiring it, please consider taking it off and giving it to them. Playfulness, kindness and generosity are the coins of our realm and we hope you will share. Come by to participate and, if you have stuff to donate, please drop it off on-playa early in the week or, better yet, ship it to our Davis, CA logistics hub by contacting Jon at kkostumes@gmail.com to get the details.
print_description: Come by our costume dome to discover your costumed self, and let your dreams come to life. Get dressed up and strut on the runway for all to see!

title: Dance Your Edge | Poetry in Motion w/Skye
description:
You are equal parts artist and work of art. Do you believe it? Do you express it? Or have you reached your edge?
You know that edge... the line we won't cross. That place inside from which we all shy away.
For fear of, what? Being seen? This is Burning Man. Bring it.

With movement as your medium and music your muse, join Skye and RhythmWave, and dance your edge.

No preconceptions. No expectations. Just you. You are the poet. And poetry in motion.

Dance your edge. And share your art.

title: Dancing Freedom
description: Dancing Freedom is a somatic, ecstatic and shamanic dance practice supporting the emergence of living oneness and what it truly means to be embodied. It is fun, and empowering. Any person of any age, size, color or creed can do it. We explore the ways in which the 5 elements of Earth, Water, Fire, Air and Ether may assist us in creating a deeper relationship to our Selves, others, and our environment. By having an experiential understanding of how these elements work within us, we gain tools that help us to move through life and all of its lessons in a more centered and conscious manner. When we come together we come in peace to create a deep space of shared practice, transformation and community.
print_description: Dancing Freedom is a somatic, ecstatic and shamanic dance practice supporting the emergence of living oneness and what it truly means to be embodied.

title: Dancing Freedom: Dance as Medicine
description:
Dancing Freedom is a somatic, ecstatic and shamanic dance practice supporting the emergence of living oneness and what it truly means to be embodied. It is fun, and empowering. Any person of any age, size, color or creed can do it. We explore the ways in which the 5 elements of Earth, Water, Fire, Air and Ether may assist us in creating a deeper relationship to our Selves, others, and our environment. By having an experiential understanding of how these elements work within us, we gain tools that help us to move through life and all of its lessons in a more centered and conscious manner. When we come together we come in peace to create a deep space of shared practice, transformation and community.
All one needs is the desire for health, vitality, happiness and a deeper connection to self and others. This is a free form movement practice that is safe for all abilities. It is a friendly entry point into movement as medicine and it’s a powerful addition to an existing yoga, meditation or healing practice. For more exciting information check out the Dancing Freedom website:www.dancingfreedom.com
print_description: Dancing Freedom is a somatic, ecstatic and shamanic dance practice supporting the emergence of living oneness and what it truly means to be embodied.

Feeling stressed, overwhelmed, and drained? Wanting to find balance, reclaim your center and open your shamanic body? Join us for a Dancing Freedom Journey workshop.

As we deepen in our hearts using our breath to make room for the new.  Releasing the old ways of being.  We are creating new ways of BEing in all areas of our lives.

Release Pain held in the body

title: Dancing off the Map w/Vic Cooper
description: What’s more off the map then Burning Man?  What a perfect opportunity to practice the 5Rhythm dance meditation in relation to thoughts, feeling sensations, and experience unknown to us. So often we keep ourselves safely contained in the known and expected.  But you did not come to Burning Man for that!  This class is about reminding your body how to dance with and welcome what’s new, and what's not so familiar, what may not be so comfortable, nice, known or beautiful. This is off-road dancing with off-road people; add only a slight bit of willingness, and you will quite likely get deliciously lost.

Jo's been teaching the Rhythm's in Southern California for more than 15 years.  For more information about Jo, visit her website at http://www.movinground.com/

title: Danyavaad and The Shimmy Sisters
description:
Original bellydance rock gypsy music with electric sitar, dumbek and bass. Featuring dancing, hooping, acroyoga, fire, wings, swords and community!

“I saw you all at Wanderlust and WOW, amazing performance. The ancient Bards and Muses were frolicking in the etherworlds above and below you in unison to your performance.” - John Marosi

“My expectations were exceeded! The Shimmy Sisters combined with Danyavaad, make up what is by far the best Middle Eastern influenced ensemble I have ever experienced.”
- San Diego Beach Life Magazine

“A Spiritually Rockin Journey! The full house included everyone from your all American dad with his two 10 year old daughters, to Burners and internationally known dancers, to local musicians. With standing room only, people sat on the floor, and stood between tables and chairs and by the end, the entire crowd was dancing along with them! A man in the audience said ‘it feels like I am being taken back into an ancient past ... into my nomadic past life.’ ”- The Papyrus

“Everyone was mesmerized by the sight. On stage, the beautiful Shimmy Sisters bellydanced and balanced long, sleek swords on their heads while leaning back into a somewhat contorted position. The members of Danyavaad closed their eyes and sank into the Middle Eastern-fusion music they were making, and with the skilled DJ Sandbag on bass, Gabriel Penix on dumbek and Greg Vaughan on electric sitar.”
- Kinsee Morlan of the San Diego CityBeat

“The Shimmy Sisters and Danyavaad captivated the crowd with enticing movements set to hypnotic rhythms. The belly-dancing Shimmy Sisters produced a stunning visual delight with twirling skirts intermingling with multiple colored scarves to become living, moving art. The sisters’ concentration, flexibility and control were evident as they, with flaming swords balance on their heads, stretched and twisted eliciting applause from the audience.“ - Elizabeth Guiten of the Imperial Beach Eagle & Times
print_description: Embark on a cultural journey through dance, music and the mystique of the East. Gypsy World Rock and Eclectic Bellydancing. Sitar, drums, bass.

title: Dawn to Dusk Silent Sacred Space for Connection
description: Sacred space will be held for a day of silent connection with self, others in community, and the vibrations of this city in the desert, dawn to dusk.  Please bring altar items, a yoga mat or pillow, water, etc.  This is a day where we can get together to ground, and ease into the Burning Man experience together and within.  This is a sacred space, where all we ask is respect for silence.  Eye gaze, meditate, or ground in whatever way works for you.  The Intention is to create sacred space for grounded connection.

title: D&D on the Playa
description: Ever wanted to play D&D but never had the opportunity, or haven't played in years and want to relive the glory days? Come have some fun and join us for a mid-day gaming session. We'll have everything you need, just bring your imagination and that same adventurous spirit which got you onto the playa! We'll have room for up to six players, with a 2nd session on Friday or Saturday to finish up the adventure. Newbies welcome! Cynical veterans and rules lawyers need not apply!
print_description: Ever wanted to play D&D but never had the opportunity? Come have some fun and join us for a mid-day gaming session. Designed for newbies!

title: Dealing With Jealousy
description:
Do you want to be in open relationships but are worried you'll freak out if your lover gets another lover?  Are you already nonmonogamous but having problems with intractable jealousy?  If you want to be successful in nonmonogamy, it is important to de-fang the little green monster.  Come listen to our jealousy experts as they hold forth on how to get over or at least sneak past jealousy.

This workshop is targeted at nonmonogamous people, but monogamous people dealing with jealousy issues will also find it very useful.
print_description: Have you been bitten by the jealousy beast, or someone else's jealousy?  Come listen to our experts discuss how to de-fang the little green monster.

title: Dia de los Muertos altar

Feast your ears on this shit . . . -A Killer Funk Set in Honor of the Mighty Joe Boss! -80's Underground Dance Music, not ya mama's Top-40 radio shit. -Old-School hip-hop: Whodini, Grandmaster Flash, UTFO, Dana Dane, Newcleus, Doug E. Fresh, Break yo' self fool! -Maybe some rare Pink Floyd . . . -And more Devil Music than you can take, and it will make you shake, that Ass! Sixteen hours of booty-shaking beats will be pumped through our Funktion One Sound System. Disorient has never sounded so good on the Playa! So come over and bring your best pink and orange (Pornj) attire as we get Disoriented from sunset to sunrise!

title: DJ Kaminanda
description:
Hailing from the Coast of B.C, Kaminanda produces and performs music that uplifts the spirit of the listener,while 
allowing for the natural ebb and flow of light and dark.In a style that could be described as a swirling fusion of Trip Hop ,Dub,Downtempo and Sensual Trance,Kaminanda unveils Crystalline Melodies , Ecstatic Rhythms from around the world and Beats and Bass that sway the body into surrender and release...Like an audio Oracle set, Kaminanda unfolds archetypes and elemental movements while tapping into the unlimited realms of Adventure,Beauty and Elevated States of Consciousness
print_description: Come dance Saturday night after the burn to dj Kaminanda! A live/hybrid/dj set of original tribal fusion midtempo and downtempo elemental dubhop.

title: DJ Outersect
description: Outersect is Rob Rayle, a San Francisco Bay Area based composer and producer of genre-bending psychedelic electronic music that synergizes pyschill, techno-bluegrass, and 70's progressive rock styles.  Inspired by sights and sounds form around the world, Outersect fuses acoustic instruments and sounds with digital production to emerge with his own sonic experience.  Outersect's "one-man electronic jam band" shows include live keyboard improvisation and sound loops to inspire ecstasy on the dance floor and auditory bliss.
print_description: Come dance and party at Chakralicious Camp to dj Outersect!

title: DJ Ra So
description:
A dance journey through the archetypes of human consciousness, peppered with subtlety and meaning… touching the eternal, and at the same time embracing the humanity that lies within every heart. An auditory expression of love, compassion and emotion.   Expect a journey through many layers, genres and tempos. And prepare to be engaged through mind, body and spirit in waves of rhythm and bass, harmony and melody... 
bass-heavy, psychedelic "glitch-pop," heavily infused with the Left Coast Underground sound."
print_description: Dance to dj Ra So at Chakralicious Camp!

title: DJ RobJob
description: Come dance to a set of nu-funk and lunar / voodoo / nu-disco, positive, up beat music at Chakralicious Camp. DJ RobJob has been a DJ/re-mixer in San Francisco for last 4 years, having held club residencies at Pink, Shine, and Bubble Lounge. He has also performed for a variety of events (and Burn fund raisers) at SupperClub, Temple, and Mighty. RobJob has also performed worldwide, in Hong Kong, Saigon, Madrid, Budapest, New York, and Los Angeles. He has performed at the last two Burns (at Bassyx camp and Platypus Pussy camp). He has also played saxophone since he was 8 years old, and he is active in the Bay area House Dance community.
print_description: Come dance to a set of nu-funk and lunar / voodoo / nu-disco, positive, up beat music at Chakralicious Camp.

title: DJs and the premiere of Electronic Awakening
description:
Join the herd, and come on over to miniMOO camp at 4:30 and Divorce for some dancing and MOOvie watching.***

We will be starting off the night with some great DJs spinning, so you can get your MOOve on.***

Following the DJS, we are proud to present the premiere of Electronic Awakening at 10:30 pm***

Get there early to walk the red carpet and get a good spot!***

About the film:
This film explores that trans-formative experience and the evolving spirituality of Electronic Dance Music culture.***

You can also join us on Tuesday night for a showing of High Fidelity.***

Thursday night will be a showing of Dark Side of the Rainbow/The Wizard of Floyd.***

Make sure to check out our camp at other times of the week for some MOOvie fun. We'll have a marquee at the front of the camp listing when we'll be showing MOOvies and what they'll be (expect some great rites of passage and desert favorites).
print_description: Come on over to miniMOO camp for some great djs, dancing and to watch the premiere of Electronic Awakening. You can find us at 4:30 and D.

title: DJ The Mener
description:
Dance to wildly energetic, funky heavy breaks and house laced with carnival music at Chakralicious camp!

The Mener is no stranger to the world of electronic music. Since his first introduction to the party scene in the winter of 1993, he has been addicted to the music. He soon immersed himself in many aspects of the party scene and started breakdancing and doing graffiti, but didn’t start DJ’ing until 1997. 

Around 1996, he was throwing raves and was opening his own shows by playing his first musical love: hip hop. After seeing how much more the crowd responded to house and breaks, the transition of musical choice was swift and the first emergence of the DJ we now know as The Mener was born. Since his humble beginnings, The Mener has been throwing down funky house and breaks sets in most major cities in the U.S. and has opened for a colossal list of international superstars. 

Whether it be 50 people or 5,000 people, rest assured this 14 year turntable veteran knows how to destroy dancefloors!
print_description: Dance to wildly energetic, funky heavy breaks and house laced with carnival music at Chakralicious camp!

title: DnT Chauffeur Service
description:
Out driving around on your art car and want to party? Too wasted to drive your golf cart? Put your sauced self into the back seat and let the professionals take control! Let Tesla and Dooka safely take you on the ride of your life! Don't miss out on this crucial community service.
Tour the playa like a rock star!

title: Dodgeball at Camp Red Sun
description:
Camp Red Sun is designed to be a place of fun and laughter.  We're an oasis away from the scorching sun and from any responsibilities of the outside world.

Joke telling is a huge part of our camp's experience and is integrated into our activities. With two large 30' tension tents, we have one that is high energy with music and a raging red sno-cone bar where people can laugh and play and another that is relaxing with cushions and chairs on the other side of camp where our guests can visit and get to know the people around them.

In addition we have a dodgeball court with multiple quirky themed games in a non-competitive friendly atmosphere.  Around camp there's a number of red self-tensioning hammocks for people to nap in or take a respite from the cruel sun and their explorations of the Playa.

We've also setup a mobile sno-cone crew to ride around the playa bringing sno-cones into people's camps.  We're outfitting them with an old timey "ice cream man" sound setup and we will be hunting for Burners in need of icy goodness.
print_description: Come get red in the face at Red Sun playing a game of dodgeball on a 40x30 court! Relax in our red hammocks, enjoy red sno-cones, or dodge red death!

title: Dodgeball Open Play
description: Dodgeball on the playa! It doesn’t matter if you were always the last picked and the first out, or the first picked and the last one standing. The court is open. The rules are posted. Throw, catch, and dodge your way to victory!
print_description: Dodgeball! The court is open. The rules are posted. Throw, catch, and dodge your way to victory!

title: Doors & Whiskey Happy Hour
description: Are you tired of techno? Feeling tranced out? Hear one more dub-step song, and you're gonna choke a bitch?  Jim Morrison feels your pain! The time to hesitate is through... Join us at The Next Whiskey Bar for 2 hours of nothing but whiskey drinks and a good helping of The Doors. Break on through to the other side of the playa, leave your bass at camp, and we will show you the way to The Next Whiskey bar.... Oh, don't ask why!

title: Drag Yourself To The Playa Prom!
description:
Dress as a Mister, Dress as a Miss,
Dress as Whatever but come Dressed to Impress.

Visit Camp Bacchanalia to enter and vote for your favorite Drag Prom Queen and King with prizes to be awarded to our majesties.

We'll have a DJ, a Prom Photo Area, Prom Coronation Ceremony at dusk, and some beverages throughout. Please bring more to share though! 

To run for both Prom Queen and King:

1. Enter the appropriate walk off. There will be a "Prom King Walkoff" that starts promptly at 630pm and a "Prom Queen Walkoff" that starts promptly at 7pm.
2. Winner will be decided by the audience with loudest applause at 730pm. 

You must be present to win!
